citation.name: Brain
citation.title: Czech family confirms the link between FBLN5 and Charcot-Marie-Tooth type 1 neuropathy.

comment.text: Essential for elastic fiber formation, is involved in the assembly of continuous elastin (ELN) polymer and promotes the interaction of microfibrils and ELN (PubMed:18185537). Stabilizes and organizes elastic fibers in the skin, lung and vasculature (By similarity). Promotes adhesion of endothelial cells through interaction of integrins and the RGD motif. Vascular ligand for integrin receptors which may play a role in vascular development and remodeling (PubMed:10428823). May act as an adapter that mediates the interaction between FBN1 and ELN (PubMed:17255108).

Homodimer (PubMed:20007835). Monomer (PubMed:15790312, PubMed:19617354), homodimerizes in presence of Ca(2+) (PubMed:19617354). Interacts with ELN (PubMed:17035250, PubMed:15790312). Interacts (via N-terminus) with the integrins ITGAV/ITGB3, ITGAV/ITGB5 and ITGA9/ITGB1 (By similarity). Interacts with FBN1 (via N-terminal domain). Forms a ternary complex with ELN and FBN1 (PubMed:17255108).
co-localizes with ELN in elastic fibers.

Expressed in skin fibroblasts (at protein level)(PubMed:17035250). Expressed predominantly in heart, ovary, and colon but also in kidney, pancreas, testis, lung and placenta. Not detectable in brain, liver, thymus, prostate, or peripheral blood leukocytes (PubMed:10428823).

disease.name: Neuropathy, hereditary, with or without age-related macular degeneration
disease.description: An autosomal dominant neuropathy of the Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease group, characterized by distal muscle weakness and atrophy variably affecting the lower and upper limbs. Distal sensory impairment and decreased nerve conduction velocities are present in most but not all patients. Additional variable features are age-related macular degeneration, joint hypermobility, and hyperelastic skin.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Cutis laxa, autosomal dominant, 2
disease.description: A connective tissue disorder characterized by loose, hyperextensible skin with decreased resilience and elasticity leading to a premature aged appearance. Face, hands, feet, joints, and torso may be differentially affected. Additional variable clinical features are gastrointestinal diverticula, hernia, and genital prolapse. Rare manifestations are pulmonary artery stenosis, aortic aneurysm, bronchiectasis, and emphysema.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Cutis laxa, autosomal recessive, 1A
disease.description: A connective tissue disorder characterized by loose, hyperextensible skin with decreased resilience and elasticity leading to a premature aged appearance. Face, hands, feet, joints, and torso may be differentially affected. The clinical spectrum of autosomal recessive cutis laxa is highly heterogeneous with respect to organ involvement and severity. Type I autosomal recessive cutis laxa is a specific, life-threatening disorder with organ involvement, lung atelectasis and emphysema, diverticula of the gastrointestinal and genitourinary systems, and vascular anomalies. Associated cranial anomalies, late closure of the fontanel, joint laxity, hip dislocation, and inguinal hernia have been observed but are uncommon.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry. Mutations affecting this gene can modify the phenotype of diseases caused by ELN mutations.

disease.name: Macular degeneration, age-related, 3
disease.description: A form of age-related macular degeneration, a multifactorial eye disease and the most common cause of irreversible vision loss in the developed world. In most patients, the disease is manifest as ophthalmoscopically visible yellowish accumulations of protein and lipid that lie beneath the retinal pigment epithelium and within an elastin-containing structure known as Bruch membrane.

comment.text: Disease susceptibility is associated with variations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

property.value: Hereditary sensorimotor neuropathy with hyperelastic skin
NON RARE IN EUROPE: Age-related macular degeneration
Expressed in thoracic aorta and 198 other tissues

feature.description: In ARMD3; no effect on secretion; no effect on homodimerization; dbSNP:rs121434299.
In ARMD3; no effect on secretion; no effect on homodimerization; dbSNP:rs121434300.
In ARMD3; no effect on secretion; slightly increases homodimerization in absence of Ca(2+); dbSNP:rs121434301.
In ARMD3; almost abolishes secretion; no effect on homodimerization.
Polymorphism; no effect on secretion; slightly increases homodimerization in absence of Ca(2+); dbSNP:rs61734479.
In ARMD3; decreases secretion; slightly increases homodimerization in absence of Ca(2+); no effect on protein folding; dbSNP:rs28939072.
Polymorphism; slightly increases homodimerization in absence of Ca(2+); no effect on protein folding; no effect on secretion; dbSNP:rs80338765.
In ARCL1A; formation of extracellular globular aggregates; decreases cell growth; reduces interaction with ELN; abolishes secretion; increases homodimerization; dbSNP:rs80338766.
In ARCL1A; decreases expression; produces protein misfolding; abolishes secretion; reduces interaction with ELN; increases homodimerization; impairs elastic fiber development; dbSNP:rs28939370.
In ARMD3, ARCL1A and HNARMD; produces protein misolding; decreases secretion; no effect on homodimerization; dbSNP:rs149396611.
Found in a patient with autosomal recessive cutis laxa also carrying a mutation in ELN; unknown pathological significance; dbSNP:rs377360782.
